abstract: Mandatory reading at the World Economic Forum should be two reminders from JPMorgan Chase and the Federal Reserve that we are far from understanding or preventing financial crises, the Deal Professor writes.
snippet: Mandatory reading at the World Economic Forum should be two reminders from JPMorgan Chase and the Federal Reserve that we are far from understanding or preventing financial crises, the Deal Professor writes.
lead_paragraph: The important and self-important of global finance are again gathering at the annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. This year, the mandatory reading should be two recent reminders from JPMorgan Chase and the Federal Reserve that we are light years from understanding or preventing financial crises.

headline.main: Reports Reveal Financial Challenges, but Few Solutions
headline.print_headline: Required Reading for Davos From the Fed and JPMorgan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
